thread.title: HIGH SCHOOLS: Calvary rallies to beat SCPS for Area volleyball title
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOLS: Calvary rallies to beat SCPS for Area volleyball title | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: HIGH SCHOOLS: Calvary rallies to beat SCPS for Area volleyball title
text:
SPECIAL OFFER FOR NEW READERS 99 cent digital subscription to savannahnow.com
Subscriber-members get access to ALL our digital products AND become eligible for free event tickets, discount coupons and other benefits. SIGN UP FOR SUBSCRIBER BENEFITS As a Savannah Morning News / savannahnow.com subscriber, you're eligible for members-only discounts. Download your coupons now. By Savannah Morning News Calvary Day came back from a two-set deficit to beat host Savannah Christian 22-25, 23-25, 25-22, 25-17, 15-7 and win the Area 1-A tournament title Saturday.
Savannah Christian entered the match ranked No. 1 in the state among Class A teams by Score Atlanta, while Calvary was No. 5. The Cavaliers will be a No. 1 seed in the Class A tournament and will host a first-round match Thursday, SCPS will also host in the first round as a No. 2 seed.
“This is a huge win for us. In my three years coaching at Calvary, this is the first time we beat Savannah Christian,” Calvary coach Hannah Hunter said. “It was definitely a sweet win. We’re peaking at the right time. We made a lot of service errors and mistakes in the first two sets, but then we rallied together as a team. The girls played tough and had that mindset to win that we hadn’t had previously against Savannah Christian.”
Setter Hannah Carver dished out 49 assists and had eight digs, while Claudia Chisolm had 24 kills and 13 digs. Sara Daniels had 14 kills, and Southern Britt (16 digs) and Rachel Hill (15 digs) anchored a strong defensive effort for the Cavaliers (27-9).
Savannah Christian (33-7) was led by Landon Jones, who had 20 kills and 15 digs. Lainey Aenchbacher had 37 assists and nine digs, and Sarah Allen added 12 kills and 10 digs.
Area 1-A Tournament
At Savannah Christian
Calvary Day def. Savannah Christian 22-25, 23-25, 25-22, 25-17, 15-7
Top players—CD, Hannah Carver 49 assists, 8 digs; Claudia Chisolm 24 kills, 13 digs; Southern Britt 16 digs, 2 aces; Rachel Hill 15 digs; Sara Daniels 14 kills, 3 blocks. SCPS, Sarah Allen 12 kills, 10 digs; Landon Jones 20 kills, 15 digs; Adrianna Simon 10 kills; Lainey Aenchbacher 37 assists, 9 digs, 15/15 serving; Mary Price Brown 2 aces, 6 digs; Hannah White 3 aces, 4.5 blocks; Emilee Wissmach 17 digs, 4 assists, Record—CD 27-9.
Calvary Day def. Savannah Country Day 25-13, 25-13
Top players-CD, Carver 22 assists, 3 aces, 2 digs; Chisolm 8 kills, 7 aces, 6 digs; Morgan Pearson 8 kills; Britt 4 digs. SCD, Ana Schretter 4 kills, 1 ace; Brittany Hodges 3 kills; Abigail Kahn 5 assists, 3 digs.
Savannah Christian def. Aquinas
Top players—SCPS, Allen 5 kills, 3 aces; Jones, 5 kills, 4 assists; Adrianna Simon 6 kills; Mackenzie Riner 3 kills; Aenchbacher 13 assists, 2 aces; Mary Price Brown 3 aces, 6 digs; Wissmach 3 assists, 4 digs; White, 3 kills; Sam Zittrauer 4 assists. Record—SCPS 33-6.
Savannah Country Day def. Aquinas 25- 19, 25-15
Top players—SCD, Anna Muller 6 kills, 4 aces; Lily Glass 8 assists; Hodges 3 kills, 2 blocks, 2 aces; Schretter 2 kills, 3 assists, 5 aces, 10 digs; Bronwyn Tait 8 digs, 2 aces; Kahn 8 assists, 2 aces.
REGION 2-AA TOURNAMENT
At Groves
St. Vincent’s won its sixth straight Region 2-AA tournament without dropping a set as the Saints rolled to wins over Harlem in both the semifinal and final.
Junior Sarah Stewart had 15 kills and Sydney Sanders added 26 assists in the final. Avery Grimm was red hot from the service line with 22 aces, and Grace Friday added six kills.
“We have a veteran team that has been playing together since they were in middle school,” SVA coach Lindsey McIntyre said. “We have a lot of talented athletes, and they are dedicated players who have worked hard all season to get ready for the playoffs.”
SVA will host a first-round playoff match Oct. 20.
St. Vincent’s def. Harlem 25-4, 25-7, 25-6
Top players—SVA, Sarah Stewart 15 kills, 2 assists, 2 aces, 3 digs; Sydney Sanders 3 kills, 26 assists, 2 aces, 2 digs; Avery Grimm 22 aces, 3 digs; Grace Friday 6 kills; McKenzie O’Hayer 3 kiils, 5 aces. Record-SVA 27-13.
St. Vincent’s def. Harlem 25-10, 25-12
Top players—SVA, Stewart 7 kills, 4 aces, 3 digs; Sanders 3 kills, 15 assists, 2 aces; Grimm 3 aces, 3 digs; Friday 4 kills; O’Hayer 5 aces.
St. Vincent’s def. Dublin 25-5, 25-6
Top players—SVA, Sarah Stewart 7 kills, 15 aces, 4 digs; Sanders 11 assists, 8 aces; Avery Grimm 2 aces, 4 digs; Payton Maxheimer 8 aces.
REGION 3- TOURNAMENT
Finals
Glynn Academy def. South Effingham 25-14, 23-25, 25-19, 25-22
Top players—SE, Emma Williams 3 aces, 6 digs, 6 kills; 17 assists, 3 blocks; Faith Harris 14-16, 1 aces, 8 digs, 2 kills; Shae Leverett 9-9, 7 digs, 14 kills, 14 blocks; Brandi Wooten, 7 digs, 13 assists; Zoie Vandine 10-12 serving, 4 blocks, ace. Tessa Cormack 7 digs, 6 kills. Record—SE 38-11.
REGION 1-AAA TOURNAMENT
at Johnson
Savannah Arts won its third straight Region 1-AAA title without dropping a set in three matches. The Panthers (29-8, 23-0 in region) swept Southeast Bulloch 25-18, 25-17, 25-7 in the finals behind the strong play of Peyton Vacala, Emily Daugherty and Kerry Halliburton.
“The key for our success has been our chemistry,” SAA coach Jeff Fortson said. “We have the region player of the year in Peyton Vacala, but she doesn’t act like a superstar. Everything is about the team with her. Everyone has bought into that team concept, and it has paid off.”
The Panthers will host a first-round playoff match on Wednesday.
Savannah Arts def. Southeast Bulloch 25-18, 25-17, 25-7
Top players—SA, Emily Daugherty 11 kills, 4 aces, 5 digs; Peyton Vacala 10 kills, 3 aces, 5 digs; Kerry Halliburton 21 assists, 2 aces, 4 digs; Clara Kennedy 5 aces, 3 kills, 11 digs; Brai Fortson 2 aces, 5 kills 5 digs. Records—SA 29-8, 23-0 in region.
Savannah Arts def. Toombs Co. 25-12, 25-10
Top players—SA, Vacala 7 kills, 2 aces, 5 digs; Halliburton 7 assists, 3 digs; Muriel Nave 3 blocks, 4 kills; Kennedy 7 aces, 3 digs.
Savannah Arts def. Johnson 25-3, 25-2
Top players—SA, Vacala 33/33 serving, 18 aces, 3 kills, 4 digs; Halliburton 5 assists; Daugherty 5 aces; Peyton Elmgren 4 kills.
ALL-REGION 1-AAA TEAM
Player of the Year—Peyton Vacala, Savannah Arts
Coach of the Year—George Johnson, Savannah High
First team (local players)
Cha’Kiera Sibert, Savannah High; Dy’Manee Royal, Beach; Callie Leonard, Islands; Asia Rosier, Jenkins; Arkierra Fulton, Jenkins; Kristen Moore, Islands; Courtney Matthews, Johnson; Calia Harris, Beach; Brai Fortson, Savannah Arts; Sha’Kym Holland, Savannah High.
Second team
Amber Tran, Islands; Brittany Walker, Islands; Ellery Duck, Islands; Erin Davis, Beach; Kerry Halliburton, Savannah Arts; Clara Kennedy, Savannah Arts; Emily Daugherty, Savannah Arts; Kaylan Martin, Savannah High.
Honorable mention
Jaelyn Green, Johnson; Karrrana Morris, Beach; Muriel Nave, Savannah Arts; Sha’Miah Kidd, Savannah High; Jeanette Jones, Savannah High; Kyleigh Kestner, Jenkins; Shannon Ayala, Jenkins.
CROSS COUNTRY
Mattie Harris leads Calvary
COCHRAN — Calvary Day freshman Mattie Harris won the individual title and St. Vincent’s Academy captured the girls team crown at the Bleckley County Invitational.
Harris was fastest in the 5K in 19 minutes, 56 seconds, while her sister, junior Moriah Harris, was fourth (22:09). The Cavaliers did not have enough runners to qualify as a team.
St. Vincent’s, which won with 48 points, was led by eighth-place Emilye Eischeid (22:36) and ninth-place Sara Kathryn Boyles (22:56).
Bleckley County Invitational at Cochran
Boys
Top local runners — 21. Carson Riddick, Benedictine, 19:23; 30. Erick Rojas, BC, 19:50; 32. Elijah Harris, Calvary Day, 19:55; 34. Aiden Broker, BC, 20:09; 40. Nate Hickey, BC, 20:23; 42. Will Gladden, BC, 20:25; 43. Malachi Culbreth, CDS, 20:29; 45. Justin Greene, BC, 20:37; 50. Ryan Ducey, BC, 20:46; 51. Troy Woolridge, BC, 20:52.
Team—5. Benedictine 126.
Girls
Top local runners — 1. Mattie Harris, CDS, 19:56; 4. Moriah Harris, CDS, 22:09; 8. Emilye Eischeid, St. Vincent’s, 22:36; 9. Sara Kathryn Boyles, SVA, 22:56; 13. Isabelle Macdonald, SVA, 23:41; 14. Meghan Vierheilig, SVA, 23:47; 20. Maddie Geha, SVA, 24:52; 21. Brynne Acuff, SVA, 24:56; 37. Alexis Salgueiro,SVA, 27:11; 51. Teagan Prodin, SVA, 28:26.
Team—1. SVA 48.
Late Friday
FOOTBALL
LIBERTY COUNTY 26,
BURKE COUNTY 20
Liberty County improved to 5-2 (2-0 in Region 3-AAAA) with a win over Burke County, ranked No. 8 among Class AAAA schools by the Georgia Sports Writers Association.
The Panthers took a 20-0 lead in the first quarter. Wake Forest-commit Jacquez Williams had 18 carries for 205 yards and two touchdowns. Richard LeCounte had rushed for 75 yards and a score. Jaalon Frazier connected with Eli Polite with a 33-yard scoring strike. Liberty hosts Thomson on Friday for the region championship.
LONG COUNTY 46,
NEW HAMPSTEAD 24
Calvin Turner rushed for 210 yards and two scores for New Hampstead in a loss to Long County.
NH 0 0 8 16 — 24
LC 22 12 6 6 — 46
